item.title: Reflections on the first month in the West
item.description: Hello! Today is the 28th of August, which marks exactly a month of my time here in the West, more specifically in the United States of America. The journey to the West seemed daunting and close to impossible when I first registered for an English proficiency test, which exists for people who want to travel to the West and are not native English speakers (like me). My journey It started on a sad note after waving a teary goodbye to my parents and relatives back home.

item.title: Reflections on first tech talk
item.description: Giving a tech talk was no more than a far-fetched idea until I interacted with Vincent who was kind enough to sponsor a ticket for remotely held Python Pizza conference during COVID. Quoting him from our twitter DM conversation You can always contribute to a 5 minute lightning talk. There’s bound to be a super awesome function that you’ve learned that others don’t know about. Fast forward two years, I was fortunate that my workplace organised the 68th meetup of Golang Bangalore, and I managed to talk about the Go scheduler and the syscalls which a Go program makes during runtime.

item.title: About this site
item.description: This site is powered by a Hugo theme called lekh which is a Hugo clone(almost) of https://www.vegardstikbakke.com/ Lekh is my first take at designing a Hugo theme, and apart from the tiny bit of templating specific to Hugo in Golang, the rest is copied as it is from Vegard’s site. Also the dark mode is taken as it is from https://www.gwern.net/
